name: DoubleTree by Hilton London Victoria

reviews.text: The best thing about the hotel is the location. Coming from Heathrow you can take the tube, change once in Hammersmith by simply walking across the platform and then getting off at Victoria station. The hotel itself was ok. Had a room to the back, which was quiet, but no view to speak of. Internet is only free in the lobby.
reviews.title: Great Location
Disappointed
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights in room 326 at the front of the Hotel. Noise from the rubbish bins went on all through the night.
I complained to the hotel management who could not move me as all the rooms on the back of the hotel were full as it is a known problem and they have raised the noise levels with the station.
reviews.title: What a shabby place!

reviews.text: The room was also cold
reviews.title: dissapointing stay at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the complaint they did not discount the room
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Hotel for a weekend visit to London specifically to take in a show at the Apollo. The location is absolutely perfect for Victoria Tube and Train stations and the Apollo; all less than a two minute walk away. The room wasn't massive but a perfect base for exploring London. We walked to Hyde Park, Buckingham Palace and down to Nelsons Column and the London Eye. The staff were very friendly and accommodating and we would certainly recommend this hotel to friends
reviews.title: Theatre Stay

reviews.text: I stayed here with my daughter & her friend (aged 13/14). Location is just seconds around the corner from Victoria station and a lot of the theatres (we saw Wicked). Plenty of restaurants near-by for pre-theatre meal. Taxi rank also a stone's throw away. Also very central to take the tube anywhere. Beware if booking a "family room". They give you a standard room and attempt to put a single bed in the room aw well. This would mean absolutely no room to walk around either beds. To the hotel's credit, when I complained, they changed our room to the disabled room which was much bigger with a much larger bathroom but has a walk-in shower (like a wet room). It was perfect for us and appreciated the hotel's attitude to help make us more comfortable. I had read reviews about the noise - we were on the second floor right by the lift and didn't hear a thing either from outside of other guests. We also took advantage of pre-paying for our breakfast the next morning (it wasn't included in my room rate) @ £13 for me and the girls were free. It was perfectly adequate and typical of a hotel buffet breakfast. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: You stay here because you want to be close to Victoria. But here you are almost too close: Victoria is a noisy place and there is all sorts of noise all night. I was woken a number of times in the night. The room I stayed in looked like it had just been renovated and I can't fault anything about the hotel except possibly the windows being too thin. When I stayed there was no fitness center but they were giving out access to the nearby LA Fitness which has a pool and is in just about every respect better than hotel gyms. There is also frequently a relatively good points plus cash rate for Hilton HHonors members. And the cash rates are not too bad either.
reviews.title: Noise is an issue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent rooms by London standards, for what I felt was a reasonable price. I've stayed here since it was called the Hesperia. The staff is generally pleasant. There was a very nice indoor pool and sauna, which at the price I paid was quite surprising for London. The proximity to Victoria station is really helpful.
reviews.title: Great location, good rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ideally located just around the corner from Victoria therefore a perfect base for a trip to London. Staff were all friendly and the hotel is nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Following a below par stay a few months ago I found myself back in the Hilton Victoria.
reviews.title: Significantly improved second time around
Great location
reviews.text: This time around I couldn't fault a thing. Lovely refurbished room, blackout curtains and a beautiful modern slate and marble bathroom.
The room was quiet overlooking a courtyard at the back. Had a great sleep, fully refreshed for a busy day ahead.
reviews.title: Always an enjoyable stay.

reviews.text: Well done Hilton for restoring my confidence in you!
reviews.title: decent for business

reviews.text: Great weekend stay, arrived early so could not check in until later. Ditched my bag and went out exploring, came back to find they had checked me in. Nice clean room with everything you need, one issue was the air con wasn't working properly but a call downstairs and maintenance were up... very pleasant and helpful and fixed it within minutes. All staff were great. Amazing location, 1 min from Victoria and about 10 mins from Buckingham Palace.
reviews.title: Good value, great location, spacious rooms

reviews.text: The hotel itself is as expected and generally pleasant - the room was well equiped and comfortable - however, i have one main complaint that you need to be aware of. Do not let them give you room 126.
reviews.title: Room 126

reviews.text: located near where you rest your head, whilst sleeping, is a MDF painted, removable panel running from floor to ceiling. This obviously contains the main down pipe for the sewage system.
reviews.title: Great hotel good location

reviews.text: To say that there is little if any noise attenuation is to say the least and you will have the dubious pleasure of listening to the abolutions of the rooms in the floors above flushing down the pipe. Not a pleasant sound and very intrusive. The noises became much less frequent fom midnight to approx 5 am.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff n top notch renovation

reviews.text: I cannot believe that they have not received complaints (i certainly did) and they know that the room is a problem.
reviews.title: Great Location; Nice Staff - Great Tourist Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good place to stay 2 mins walk to train and tube or taxi, only takes 15 mins to Leicester square or soho area. Good pub just around corner with great prices on drinks and food. Fantastic staff at the hotel very tentative even come back in room in evening while you are out to straiten room up leave fresh towels and chocolates
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in great location, with friendly staff

description: Conveniently located opposite Victoria Station, the DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel London – Victoria provides its valued guests with immediate link to the London wide public transport network, Gatwick via the gatwick express and Heathrow airports as well as some the city’s most popular points of interest. Major attractions, such as Buckingham Palace, the Houses of Parliament, the London Eye and the famous West end are within walking distance
